intro: Tithymalus subpubens, commonly known as the woolly tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and hairy, subpubescent stems and leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and blooms during the summer months. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
